subject: Travel
title: El Dorado: The Golden City
description: A quick, practical guide to El Dorado: The Golden City.

hook.text: Spanish conquistadors spent 200 years searching for a city made of gold in the South American jungle.

buildup.text: The legend started with a Muisca chief who covered himself in gold dust and dove into a lake as an offering.

discovery.text: Thousands of gold artifacts were found in Lake Guatavita in Colombia, confirming part of the legend.

twist.text: El Dorado was never a city. It was a ritual. The Spanish spent centuries looking for something that didn't exist.

climax.text: The search destroyed indigenous civilizations across South America. Millions died for a misunderstood legend.

punchline.text: The golden city was never a city at all.

quiz.question: What was El Dorado originally?
options: A ritual where a chief covered in gold dove into a lake
